items.title: GM to end production of electric Chevy Brightdrop vans
items.summary: General Motors will end production of its Chevy Brightdrop electric vans at its factory in Ingersol, Ontario, the company said during its third quarter earnings call Tuesday. The decision was made as slow demand in the electric van market led to hundreds of Brightdrop vehicles piling up in dealer lots in both the US and […]

items.title: HBO Max is raising prices for the third year in a row
items.summary: Another day, another price increase for a streaming service, and this time it’s HBO Max, which has higher prices for everyone at the same time that its parent company puts everything up for sale. The first price hike for HBO Max hit in early 2023 before the service changed its name, and while that decision […]

items.title: Boox’s new smartphone-sized, color e-reader is coming to the US
items.summary: First teased at IFA 2025 in September and then officially announced in China earlier this month, Boox’s next smartphone-sized e-reader is now coming to the US. Although two versions of the device are available in China, including a black-and-white model called the P6 Pro, it’s the Boox P6 Pro Color that’s coming to the US […]

items.title: Ukraine parliament amends 2025 budget, raises defence spending to wartime record
items.summary: KYIV (Reuters) -Ukraine's parliament voted on Tuesday to amend the country's budget for this year, raising defence spending to a record level as the war with Russia dragged on into its fourth year. Read full story

items.title: Tether, the world's largest issuer of stablecoins, says it has hit 500M users; the supply of USDT nears ~$182B while Circle's USDC has ~$75B in circulation (RT Watson/The Block)
items.summary:
RT Watson / The Block:
Tether, the world's largest issuer of stablecoins, says it has hit 500M users; the supply of USDT nears ~$182B while Circle's USDC has ~$75B in circulation  —  - The world's largest stablecoin issuer said it hit 500 million users.  — “Programmable money is the ultimate social network,” Tether CEO Paolo Ardoino said.

items.title: Ricoh is making a dedicated black and white camera
items.summary: Ricoh is developing a new addition to its GR compact digital camera series that’s designed specifically for black and white photography. The GR IV Monochrome is expected to launch sometime in Spring 2026, and aside from a new monochrome CMOS sensor, it shares many of the same core features as the GR IV model that […]

items.title: This 80V Greenworks combo kit gives you a 16-inch string trimmer and 700 CFM blower at a $280 low (Reg. $400)
items.summary:
Amazon is offering the Greenworks 80V 16-inch Cordless String Trimmer and 700 CFM Leaf Blower Combo Kit that comes with a 2.5Ah battery at $279.98 shipped, with the closest matching bundle direct from the brand’s website (30 CFM more from the leaf blower) sitting $16 higher. This newer bundle package would normally cost you $400 at full price, which we’ve only seen drop down to this low rate once before, during Prime Day two weeks ago. It’s coming back around for a second opportunity to score $120 off the going rate and the best price we have tracked.

more…

items.title: Apple alerts exploit developer that his iPhone was targeted with government spyware
items.summary: A developer at Trenchant, a leading Western spyware and zero-day maker, was suspected of leaking company tools and fired. Weeks later, Apple notified him that his personal iPhone was targeted with spyware.

items.title: Malaysia to join Global Coalition for Social Justice next year
items.summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia intends to join the Global Coalition for Social Justice at the 114th International Labour Conference (ILC) next year. Read full story

items.title: ChipAgents, which is developing an agentic AI platform to automate chip design and verification, raised a $21M Series A led by Bessemer (Kyt Dotson/SiliconANGLE)
items.summary:
Kyt Dotson / SiliconANGLE:
ChipAgents, which is developing an agentic AI platform to automate chip design and verification, raised a $21M Series A led by Bessemer  —  Santa Barbara-based ChipAgents.ai today announced it raised $21M in early funding to fuel growth for its agentic artificial intelligence platform for chip design and verification.

items.title: Warner Bros. Discovery is ready for a sale
items.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery has finally said out loud what has been obvious for months now: it wants to be acquired by another entertainment megacorporation. Today, WBD announced that it “has initiated a review of strategic alternatives to maximize shareholder value” — a roundabout way of saying that the company is open to the possibility of […]

items.title: The full TechCrunch Disrupt Stage revealed: Where the future of tech breaks first
items.summary: The Disrupt Stage, only at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, is where tech’s biggest bets get made, live and unfiltered. It’s where startup dreams turn into $100,000 prizes in Startup Battlefield 200, and where the industry’s power players reveal what’s next. The industry’s biggest voices take the main-stage spotlight This year, we’re bringing Alphabet’s moonshot chief Astro Teller, Microsoft CTO Kevin Scott, Netflix CTO Elizabeth Stone, and Vinod Khosla — never one to mince words […]

items.title: Aura introduces a $499 e-ink digital photo frame that lets you go cordless
items.summary: Aura, founded by early Twitter employees, has launched the $499 Ink frame, its first 13-inch color e-paper photo frame. Using Spectra 6 e-ink technology, it offers a cordless design with up to three months of battery life and a subtle front light for better contrast

items.title: Wildly low $45 price hits Brevite’s regularly $170 weather-resistant camera backpack (73% off)
items.summary:
Brevite’s The Runner camera backpack (Lemon Yellow)

Buy for $45 (Reg. $170)

What we love

Brevite’s The Runner is a 20L travel-ready backpack with enough space to hold a camera, its lenses and accessories, and even a laptop with some spare space for clothes and other essentials. It has customizable interiors and you even remove the dividers to use it as a regular bag. Other highlights of this backpack include padded pockets for your laptop and other gear, water-resistant zippers, a luggage passthrough, and more.

more…

items.title: Brazil to decide on 2026 budget fix on Tuesday, says finance minister
items.summary: BRASILIA (Reuters) -Brazil's government expects to decide on Tuesday how to address a shortfall in its 2026 budget after a key revenue-raising measure expired without congressional approval, Finance Minister Fernando Haddad said. Read full story

items.title: HBO Max just got more expensive
items.summary: For new subscribers, the updated prices go into effect on Tuesday, while existing customers will see the change on their first billing cycle on or after November 20.

items.title: Sudan pound suffers as de facto UAE flight ban hits gold exports
items.summary: (Reuters) -The Sudanese pound has shed nearly two-fifths of its value after a de facto embargo on flights from the army's wartime capital Port Sudan into the United Arab Emirates disrupted the vital gold trade, traders and Sudanese officials said. Read full story

items.title: Russian drone attack on Ukraine's Chernihiv region kills four, police says
items.summary: KYIV (Reuters) -A Russian drone attack killed four people in Ukraine's northern Chernihiv region on Tuesday, local broadcaster Suspilne reported citing the regional police. Read full story

items.title: German chancellor faces growing backlash over migration remarks
items.summary: BERLIN (Reuters) -A senior member of Friedrich Merz's party joined growing criticism of the German chancellor on Tuesday over comments on migration that opponents have depicted as dangerous. Read full story

items.title: Europe's leaders back Trump call for frontline freeze but Russia says no
items.summary: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov rejects the idea of halting the conflict at the current contact line.

Tapo says the C615F can operate for as long as 24 hours with just 45 minutes of sunlight, and it’s now available through Tapo’s online store and Amazon for $89.99 for a […]

items.title: US chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky dies aged 29
items.summary: The young prodigy's "unexpected passing" was announced by his family on Monday.

items.title: MAG investigates cabin pressure scare on flight MH2742
items.summary: PETALING JAYA: Malaysia Aviation Group (MAG) said it has commenced its investigation into a sudden cabin pressure issue aboard its flight MH2742 on Tuesday (Oct 21), which left passengers terrified. Read full story

items.title: Enjoy commutes and/or joyrides down streets or off-road on Rad’s RadRover 6 Plus e-bike for $1,399 (Reg. $1,599)
items.summary:
As part of its ongoing Haul-o-ween Sale, Rad Power Bikes is offering a solo price cut (as opposed to bundles of FREE gear) on the RadRover 6 Plus Fat Tire e-bike to $1,399 shipped. This popular model would normally run you $1,599 at full price, with discounts over the year having mostly dropped the cost between $1,399 and $1,299, though we have seen some rare falls further to the $1,199 low. It may not be the lowest price, but you’re still looking at a solid $200 slashed from the tag for the third-lowest price we have tracked.

more…

items.title: Microsoft’s emergency Windows 11 update fixes a nasty system recovery bug
items.summary: Microsoft is now rolling out an out-of-band fix for Windows 11 to address a major bug the company introduced with its latest monthly Windows 11 update. The original update released on October 14th accidentally broke the Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE), leaving people unable to use a USB mouse or keyboard to recover their PCs or […]

items.title: Hulu with Live TV now costs $90 monthly but you can lock in $65 for three months
items.summary: Hulu raised the price of its Live TV service to $89.99 today, October 21st, for current subscribers. However, new and returning subscribers (who haven’t had an active subscription for a month) can get Hulu with Live TV for $64.99 per month (was $82.99) for the first three months of their subscription. The deal runs until […]

items.title: Only 6 days until TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 kicks off in San Francisco and ticket rates increase
items.summary: Less than 6 days until TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 takes over San Francisco’s Moscone West! The countdown is on for the year's biggest gathering of founders, investors, and innovators shaping the future of tech. Register here to save up to $444 on your pass, plus an additional 60% no your +1's.

items.title: Ninja Gaiden 4 releases today, grab a copy with a FREE $10 Xbox gift card
items.summary:
The brand new Ninja Gaiden 4 has released today on (just about) all major platforms, the reviews are in, and by just about all accounts the game is more than living up to expectations. If you haven’t landed a copy but are looking to score one in the early days, Newegg is offering a nice little early launch day bonus deal on the Xbox Series X|S digital copy. Both the standard edition at $69.99 and the Deluxe Edition at $89.99 are shipping with a FREE $10 Xbox gift card right now. All you have to do is drop the game in your cart and you’ll receive the free gift card alongside the Dark Dragon Descendant Yakumo Skin. PS5 gamers are unfortunately stuck paying full price as it is still starting at $70 on the PlayStation Store and over at Amazon. 

more…

items.summary:
Today, Whisker, one of the brands at the top of the autonomous litter box hill, is launching three new models of its popular Litter-Robot series, which are bringing the most advanced systems yet, as well as some bonus intelligent tech in the form of a pet tracker and a membership service. This new generation of releases goes beyond cleaning, as all these new products are aimed at providing more personalized connection for pets and their human companions. Head below to learn all about these new releases, and be sure to keep your eye out for our upcoming review of one such unit.

items.title: Originally $70 Cherry XTRFY M50 wireless gaming mouse 71% off today at just $20
items.summary:
We just spotted a deal at Amazon that drops Cherry’s XTRFY M50 wireless gaming mouse in black down to $19.99 Prime shipped. Folks without a Prime membership can dodge the shipping fee by checking out with items worth over $35 in the cart. This is originally a $69 unit that has lately been sitting at $40. Today’s deal shaves an additional 50% off to land it $20 below its usual going rate. This is the lowest price we have tracked for this model, now 71% off its listed price. The same mouse in white, in case you’re wondering, is down to $40. Head below for more details.
